text: Edgar Douglas Adrian, 1st Baron Adrian OM PRS 30 November 1889 - 8 August 1977) was an English doctor. He won the 1932 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine with Charles Scott Sherrington for the discoveries about the functions of neurons. == References == Category:1889 births Category:1977 deaths Category:Alumni of the University of Cambridge Category:English physicians Category:Order of Merit Category:British Nobel Prize winners Category:British neuroscientists
title: Edgar Adrian, 1st Baron Adrian
